skill.description: Expert at TSDoc comments, Storybook stories, VitePress docs, TypeDoc API generation. Use when documenting code, adding comments, creating stories, or generating API docs.

skill.author: CrazySwami

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation template skill with no executable code. All 53 static findings are false positives: SHA-256 hashes were misidentified as weak crypto, markdown code fences were misidentified as shell execution, and metadata fields were misidentified as security risks. The skill only contains documentation templates for TSDoc, Storybook, VitePress, and TypeDoc.

content.value_statement: Writing documentation takes time away from coding. This skill provides expert templates for TSDoc comments, Storybook stories, VitePress guides, and TypeDoc API references so you can document faster.
actual_capabilities: Generate TSDoc comments with @param, @returns, and @example tags
Create Storybook stories with Meta and StoryObj types
Generate TypeDoc API documentation from code
Add documentation to functions, hooks, components, and interfaces
limitations: Does not analyze code to extract documentation automatically
Requires user to specify what to document
Limited to TypeScript and React codebases

use_cases.title: Document exported functions
use_cases.description: Add TSDoc comments to functions with parameters, return types, and examples

use_cases.title: Create component stories
use_cases.description: Write Storybook stories for React components with args and variants

use_cases.title: Build API reference docs
use_cases.description: Generate TypeDoc API documentation from TSDoc comments

prompt_templates.title: Document a function
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need TSDoc for a function
prompt_templates.prompt: Add TSDoc comments to this function with @param, @returns, and @example tags.

prompt_templates.title: Create component story
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Storybook story for this React component with default, loading, and error states.

prompt_templates.title: Document a hook
prompt_templates.prompt: Add TSDoc documentation to this custom hook including options, return values, and usage example.

prompt_templates.title: Generate API docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate TypeDoc API documentation and update the VitePress sidebar for this component.

output_examples.input: Document this function that fetches user data
output: Brief description of what the function does
@param userId - The unique identifier for the user
@returns Promise resolving to user data object

output_examples.input: Create a Storybook story for a Button component
output: Loading variant with isLoading: true prop
Disabled variant with isDisabled: true prop

best_practices: Include @example tags with runnable code snippets
Document all exported functions and types
Use consistent TSDoc format across your codebase
Run 'pnpm docs:api' after adding TSDoc comments
anti_patterns: Skipping @param or @returns tags for complex functions
Forgetting to update Storybook when component props change
Not running TypeDoc to regenerate API docs

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Supports TSDoc, Storybook, VitePress, and TypeDoc.

faq.question: What file types can this skill document?
faq.answer: Supports TypeScript (.ts, .tsx) files including functions, hooks, components, and interfaces.

faq.question: Can this skill analyze existing code?
faq.answer: No. You must specify what to document. The skill provides templates but does not extract documentation automatically.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads, writes, and edits files you specify. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why are my docs not appearing?
faq.answer: Run 'pnpm docs:api' to regenerate TypeDoc output. Ensure VitePress sidebar includes new files.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub Copilot?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured documentation templates following TSDoc and Storybook standards rather than auto-completing code.
